skill.name: etetoolkit
skill.description: Phylogenetic tree toolkit (ETE). Tree manipulation (Newick/NHX), evolutionary event detection, orthology/paralogy, NCBI taxonomy, visualization (PDF/SVG), for phylogenomics.
skill.summary: Phylogenetic tree toolkit (ETE). Tree manipulation (Newick/NHX), evolutionary event detection, ortho...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: The skill is a legitimate scientific bioinformatics tool. All 434 static findings are false positives. The 'Ruby/shell backtick' detections are markdown code block delimiters, not command execution. 'External commands' flagged are documentation examples for package installation. 'Weak cryptographic' findings are misidentified scientific function names. The Python scripts (tree_operations.py, quick_visualize.py) contain standard tree manipulation utilities with no security risks.

content.user_title: Analyze phylogenetic trees with ETE toolkit
content.value_statement: ETE toolkit streamlines phylogenetic analysis for evolutionary biology research. Process tree data, detect evolutionary events, and create publication-ready visualizations.
actual_capabilities: Load and manipulate phylogenetic trees in Newick, NHX, PhyloXML, and NeXML formats
Detect evolutionary events (duplications, speciations) in gene trees using tree reconciliation
Integrate with NCBI taxonomy database for species information and lineage analysis
Create publication-quality tree visualizations in PDF, SVG, and PNG formats
Calculate tree distances using Robinson-Foulds metric and compare topologies
Analyze hierarchical clustering data with heatmaps and cluster quality metrics
limitations: Requires PyQt5 for GUI visualization features
NCBI taxonomy database download (~300MB) occurs on first use
Very large trees (>10,000 leaves) require memory optimization using iterators

use_cases.title: Identify orthologs from gene trees
use_cases.description: Analyze gene trees to find orthologous genes across species for comparative genomics studies.

use_cases.title: Visualize phylogenetic relationships
use_cases.description: Create publication-ready figures showing evolutionary relationships with custom styling and annotations.

use_cases.title: Process tree datasets programmatically
use_cases.description: Batch process hundreds of phylogenetic trees for large-scale evolutionary analyses.

prompt_templates.title: Load and explore tree
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the phylogenetic tree from 'tree.nw' and display basic statistics including number of leaves, total nodes, and tree depth.

prompt_templates.title: Find orthologs
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this gene tree to identify orthologs of 'human_gene1' and create a table showing orthologous genes in each species.

prompt_templates.title: Create visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a circular tree visualization with species names colored by taxonomy group and bootstrap values >0.9 highlighted in green.

prompt_templates.title: Batch process trees
prompt_templates.prompt: Process all .nw files in the directory: midpoint root each tree, remove branches with <0.5 support, and save as 'processed_[filename].nw'

output_examples.input: Load tree and show basic statistics
output: Tree appears to be bifurcating with good resolution

best_practices: Use PhyloTree class for gene tree analysis with evolutionary event detection
Preserve branch lengths when pruning trees to maintain phylogenetic accuracy
Use vector formats (PDF/SVG) for publication figures to ensure scalability
anti_patterns: Using Tree instead of PhyloTree for gene family and evolutionary analysis
Rendering raster images for publication instead of vector formats
Loading entire large trees into memory when iterators can reduce memory usage

faq.question: What file formats does ETE support?
faq.answer: ETE supports Newick, NHX, PhyloXML, and NeXML formats for tree input and output operations.

faq.question: How do I install visualization dependencies?
faq.answer: Install PyQt5: sudo apt-get install python3-pyqt5 on Ubuntu, or brew install qt@5 on macOS.

faq.question: Why is NCBI taxonomy download taking so long?
faq.answer: First download is approximately 300MB. The database is cached locally and only downloads once.

faq.question: How do I handle very large trees?
faq.answer: Use iterator methods like iter_leaves() instead of get_leaves() to reduce memory consumption significantly.

faq.question: What is the difference between Tree and PhyloTree classes?
faq.answer: PhyloTree extends Tree with methods for evolutionary analysis, gene/species mapping, and event detection.

faq.question: How do I color tree branches by support values?
faq.answer: Use NodeStyle with conditional coloring based on node.support values in a custom layout function.
